channel.title: Russia – Glen's Parallax Perspectives
channel.description: This is independent from any organization or political party. It provides information, analysis, and resources about a wide variety of issues and opportunities related to peace, nonviolence, social justice, economic justice, and how to make our world better.

item.title: We need PEACE instead of provoking war with Russia.
item.dc:creator: GlenAnderson
item.category: International Affairs (Click to see specific nations and regions)
Our Current Political Crisis (in addition to Trump and Trumpism)
Peace (See Foreign Policy and specific nations and regions -- and ALSO see Military Spending and Nuclear Weapons)
Political Parties and Elections (Also see Democracy ...)
item.description: As soon as the Russian Revolution occurred in 1917, the U.S. treated that nation as an enemy.  Although the Soviet Union was an ally with the U.S. in opposing Nazi Germany, when Japan was ready to surrender in 1945, the U.S. unnecessarily dropped two atomic bombs on Japan — partly in order to intimidate the Soviet Union.  For many decades from 1945 until the USSR collapsed in 1991, the U.S. kept treating that nation as an enemy with whom we were locked in a Cold War that was ready at any moment to destroy the entire world with nuclear weapons.  [...]

item.title: The U.S.’s bullying of NATO is very dangerous for the whole world
item.dc:creator: GlenAnderson
item.category: International Affairs (Click to see specific nations and regions)
Our Current Political Crisis (in addition to Trump and Trumpism)
Peace (See Foreign Policy and specific nations and regions -- and ALSO see Military Spending and Nuclear Weapons)
item.description: Michael Klare’s smart article below lays out the context for the dangerous escalation of a new nuclear arms race: Dividing the World Into Opposing Camps Is the Road to Armageddon Washington aims to recast NATO in the image of the US military, with its focus on “great power competition” and a renewed arms race with Russia and China. By Michael T. Klare for The Nation https://www.thenation.com/article/world/new-cold-war-china/

item.title: Weaponizing space is VERY DANGEROUS!
item.dc:creator: GlenAnderson
item.category: International Affairs (Click to see specific nations and regions)
Peace (See Foreign Policy and specific nations and regions -- and ALSO see Military Spending and Nuclear Weapons)
Trump and Trumpism (Also see Our Current Political Crisis)
item.description: The “national security” baloney that has caused many stupid, endless wars — and the extremely dangerous nuclear weapons arms race since the 1940s — is escalating into space, regardless of the 1967 treaty that prohibits militarizing space. Trump — and now Biden — have been making Planet Earth more dangerous.   Karl Grossman, one of the world’s top experts on space weapons, wrote this powerful June 16, 2021, article on escalating U.S. warfare in space”  “New Space Force laboratory opens: A breakdown on space warfare ‘autonomy.’”  It includes this quotation:  “The U.S. imperial war project, now marching headlong into the [...]

item.title: Nuclear Weapons: Sign up now for FREE ONLINE COURSE with interesting information and actions
item.dc:creator: GlenAnderson
item.category: International Affairs (Click to see specific nations and regions)
Our Current Political Crisis (in addition to Trump and Trumpism)
Peace (See Foreign Policy and specific nations and regions -- and ALSO see Military Spending and Nuclear Weapons)
item.description: This FREE ONLINE course has four 2-hour class sessions with fascinating, fresh information about the history and current realities of nuclear weapons.  Four well informed persons developed and present this course and include discussions among participants. People who have taken this course many times in the past have learned a lot and felt empowered to work to abolish nuclear weapons. The four presenters (from the Olympia WA Coalition to Abolish Nuclear Weapons) are offering it again in OCTOBER 2021.  You may choose either TUESDAYS or SATURDAYS. THIS DOCUMENT provides information about the course – and how you can sign [...]

We are offering it again in JULY. You may choose either TUESDAYS or SATURDAYS. THIS DOCUMENT provides information about the course – and how you can sign up: OCANW nuclear weapons course — JULY 2021 If you have questions, please e-mail me at glenanderson@integra.net or phone me at (360) 491-9093.   Thanks!

item.title: People wrongly assume nuclear weapons “deter” attacks on us. Let’s help people let go of the “deterrence” assumption.
item.dc:creator: GlenAnderson
item.category: Our Current Political Crisis (in addition to Trump and Trumpism)
Peace (See Foreign Policy and specific nations and regions -- and ALSO see Military Spending and Nuclear Weapons)
item.description: The general public, politicians and mainstream media all WRONGLY ASSUME that nuclear weapons “deter” attacks on the U.S.  This wrong assumption is nearly unanimous.  It is a HUGE BARRIER to moving them to reduce and abolish nuclear weapons.  In order to make progress toward peace, we absolutely must help the public, politicians and media LET GO OF the “deterrence” assumption. The “deterrence” assumption locks people into insisting that we must continue having nuclear weapons.  The “deterrence” assumption PREVENTS THEM FROM HEARING our messages about reducing and abolishing them.   The people who are working to abolish nuclear weapons do recognize [...]

item.title: “No First Use” of nuclear weapons. SEE this information. SIGN these petitions.
item.dc:creator: GlenAnderson
item.category: International Affairs (Click to see specific nations and regions)

item.description: On June 16, Biden and Putin will hold their first summit.  For many years Russia has pledged NOT to use nuclear weapons first, but the U.S. has NEVER made such a pledge.  See the information here – and sign this petition – urging Biden and Putin to AGREE on a “NO FIRST USE” pledge:  https://mailchi.mp/baselpeaceoffice.org/invitation-to-endorse-a-no-first-use-appeal-to-presidents-biden-and-putin?e=dfcf1cbcd3   Many experts have been writing articles explaining how Biden’s foreign policy is largely indistinguishable from Trump’s.  Biden is supporting and funding many of the weapons – including NUCLEAR weapons – that Trump supported.  Please click to sign this message urging Biden to pledge “NO [...]

item.description: Click the link below ANY TIME to hear the recording of Glen Anderson discussing nuclear weapons legislation, etc., on Kim Dobson’s “Parallel University” radio program on KAOS-FM, 89.3 Olympia. This is an easy way to learn about important federal legislation and policies about nuclear weapons (and also the historic Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons).  Kim Dobson’s Parallel University radio program on Thursday May 11, 2021, featured Glen Anderson discussing these issues.  You can listen now or any time at your convenience through this MP 3 link:  Parallel U 5-13-21.mp3 Also, you can read the document linked below, [...]

item.description: The June 2021 interview on “Glen’s Parallax Perspectives” TV series helps you understand the problems in U.S. foreign policy and some bold ways to solve those problems and support peace and justice worldwide. Two guests explored the problems and solutions: John Feffer is a Project Director working on a variety of foreign policy issues at the Institute for Policy Studies, an exceptionally savvy non-profit organization based in Washington DC. Their website is ips-dc.org.  I enjoyed reading his writings for a long time, even before I recruited him to be a guest for this interview. Metta Spencer is a retired professor [...]

item.title: Nuclear Weapons LEGISLATION and POLICIES need our actions now!
item.dc:creator: GlenAnderson
item.category: International Affairs (Click to see specific nations and regions)
Nonviolence (Also see Peace, Conflict Resolution, Organizing & Activism)
Our Current Political Crisis (in addition to Trump and Trumpism)
Peace (See Foreign Policy and specific nations and regions -- and ALSO see Military Spending and Nuclear Weapons)
Trump and Trumpism (Also see Our Current Political Crisis)
item.description: Ordinary Americans want peace, but BOTH of the big political parties keep supporting and funding nuclear weapons, regardless of which party is in the White House or which party runs Congress. I have been updating the attached document that urges us to inform ourselves and take action about a number of very important pieces of federal legislation and related policies. SEE THIS DOCUMENT: Nuclear Weapons legislation and policies need our action now — Updated to May 9 2021
